DataElement.preferredDefinition: The rating assigned based on a standardized scale to describe the severity of liver cirrhosis.  It is used to determine the prognosis of metastatic disease and required strength of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any diagnosis indicating the presence of metastatic disease._A standardized rating scale used to assess the severity of liver cirrhosis and determine the prognosis, the required strength of treatment, and the necessity of liver transplantation. This instrument uses the following clinical and lab criteria: encephalopathy grade, ascites, bilirubin, albumin, and prothrombin index.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any diagnosis indicating the presence of metastatic disease.

Concepts.definition: Any diagnosis indicating the presence of metastatic disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale used to assess the severity of liver cirrhosis and determine the prognosis, the required strength of treatment, and the necessity of liver transplantation. This instrument uses the following clinical and lab criteria: encephalopathy grade, ascites, bilirubin, albumin, and prothrombin index.

Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale used to assess the severity of liver cirrhosis and determine the prognosis, the required strength of treatment, and the necessity of liver transplantation. This instrument uses the following clinical and lab criteria: encephalopathy grade, ascites, bilirubin, albumin, and prothrombin index.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/14/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) review and approval. 12/27/19 jk created for CPTAC LIHC baseline CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale used to assess the severity of liver cirrhosis and determine the prognosis, the required strength of treatment, and the necessity of liver transplantation. This instrument uses the following clinical and lab criteria: encephalopathy grade, ascites, bilirubin, albumin, and prothrombin index._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade A (5-6 points) Well Compensated Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 100% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.

Concepts.definition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 100% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/26/2015.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade B (7-9 points) Significant Functional Compromise

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 80% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.

Concepts.definition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 80% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/26/2015.

PermissibleValues.value: Unknown: Could not be determined or unsure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 45% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.
